channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The ‘Trump-Oprah’ Voter
item.description: Many Americans think of Donald Trump as a celebrity first and a politician second, no matter his record or offenses.

item.title: China Launches Military Drills Around Taiwan as ‘Punishment’
item.description: China said the sea and air drills were meant as a “stern warning” to its opponents after Taiwan’s new president asserted the island’s sovereignty in defiance of Beijing.

item.title: U.S. intelligence agencies were using generative AI 3 years before ChatGPT was released
item.description: U.S. intelligence agencies are scrambling to embrace the AI revolution, believing they’ll otherwise be smothered by exponential data growth.

item.title: TikTok Moves to Limit Russian and Chinese Media’s Reach in Big Election Year
item.description: The platform will keep state-affiliated media accounts out of users’ feeds if they “attempt to reach communities outside their home country on current global events and affairs.”

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Families of Hostages Release Video of Abductions to Push for More Talks
item.description: Some Israeli politicians seized on the images to try to rebuff the decision by three European countries to unilaterally recognize a Palestinian state.

item.title: Renault boss lament's Volkswagen's inability to 'work as a team' as joint cheap EV plan collapses
item.description: Renault CEO Luca de Meo had been trying to collaborate on an affordable version of the Twingo.

item.title: Yellen Warns Israel Against Cutting off Palestinian Banks
item.description: The Treasury secretary said that allies from the Group of 7 nations must work to stabilize the West Bank economy and increase Gaza aid.

item.title: New Video Shows Hamas Fighters Taking Israeli Soldiers Hostage
item.description: The Israeli military showed family members of the hostages the video a few weeks ago and gave them a copy on Tuesday, which they shared.

item.title: Biden’s tariffs on Chinese EVs make sense—but only for a while
item.description: The Biden administration aims to create a defensible moat so that U.S. automakers’ efforts to build competitive EVs are not wiped out by Chinese imports.

item.title: A.I. Promised to Upend the 2024 Campaign. It Hasn’t Yet.
item.description: With less than six months until the 2024 election, the political uses of A.I. are more theoretical than transformational. “This is the dog that didn’t bark,” said one adviser to a Democratic donor.

item.title: Iran Prepares to Bury President Raisi
item.description: The president, who died in a helicopter crash, will be buried at a shrine in the northeastern city of Mashhad, his hometown.

item.title: How do I choose the right cofounder for my startup?
item.description: Bonobos and Pie founder Andy Dunn answers questions about finding the right cofounder and the trade-off between startup life and family stability.

item.title: Addressing Immigration
item.description: We explain the history of Biden’s immigration policy and explain what’s likely to happen next.

item.title: Stage Collapses at Campaign Rally in Mexico, Killing at Least 9
item.description: Strong wind caused the collapse in northern Mexico as a presidential hopeful campaigned for a local candidate, officials said. Dozens of people were injured.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says there's a chance the Fed could further hike rates instead of cutting
item.description: "Do I think that rates can go up a little bit? Yes I do. And if they do is the world prepared for it? Not really."
